pullRequest.title: Copy specific wrapper files needed to run the gocd-server in a container
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue: #0
Description:

Remove deprecated MAINTAINER instruction
Reduce number of intermediate layers

beforeCommit.message:
Copy specific wrapper files needed to run the gocd-server in a container
* Remove deprecated MAINTAINER instruction
* Reduce number of intermediate layers

afterCommit.message:
Copy specific wrapper files needed to run the gocd-server in a container
* Remove deprecated MAINTAINER instruction
* Reduce number of intermediate layers

nodes.bodyText:
My worry about this is that will silently break if the structure of the zip changes. I tried this locally and the files copied over are 197MB and the files left behind due to this are 17MB. Not sure if the risk is worth that.
Also, there is a LICENSE file there, that would be nice to copy over, if going with this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,10 +28,18 @@ RUN \
   curl --fail --location --silent --show-error "https://download.gocd.org/binaries/${fullVersion}/generic/go-server-${fullVersion}.zip" > /tmp/go-server-${fullVersion}.zip
 </#if>
 RUN unzip /tmp/go-server-${fullVersion}.zip -d /
-RUN mv /go-server-${goVersion} /go-server && chown -R ${r"${UID}"}:0 /go-server && chmod -R g=u /go-server

nodes.bodyText: I see we use curl later here. ls it not needed?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,7 +54,7 @@ enum Distro implements DistroBehavior {
       return [
         '# install glibc and zlib for adoptopenjdk',
         '# See https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-docker/blob/ce8b120411b131e283106ab89ea5921ebb1d1759/8/jdk/alpine/Dockerfile.hotspot.releases.slim#L24-L54',
-        '  apk add --no-cache --virtual .build-deps curl binutils',
